cleaned_text: Warts are benign (non-cancerous) skin growths due to infection caused by the virus named human papillomavirus (HPV). Since warts can spread to and affect others, these are very common. These can grow anywhere on the body, but in kids, warts are most commonly found on the hands, feet, and faces. Typically, warts can go away on their own, but it may take them a long time - maybe a week or a month, or a year. The good news is that warts can also be treated at home with natural remedies. Apple Cider Vinegar Make a mixture by adding 2 parts apple cider vinegar to 1 part of water. Soak a cotton ball in the mixture and put it directly on the warts of your kid. It's best to fix the cotton ball to the wart using a bandage. Remove the cotton ball after three to four hours and repeat the remedy daily until the warts go away. Castor Oil Castor oil is well-known for its antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties. So, it's a good idea to use castor oil to treat warts at home. For [warts treatment](https://www.villagepediatricgroup.com/services/wart-removal/), apply castor oil on them every day for 2 to 3 weeks. You may continue using castor oil until you get desired results. Tea Tree oil Due to its powerful anti-microbial and anti-inflammatory properties, you can use tea tree oil to [treat the warts of your kids](https://www.villagepediatricgroup.com/2023/01/20/treating-a-childs-warts-helpful-tips-you-need-to-know/). For this, make a mixture by taking 1 to 2 drops of tea tree oil in 12 drops of carrier oil such as castor oil or almond oil. Apply 3 to 4 drops of this mixture on a cotton ball and place it on the wart for 5 to 10 minutes. For better results, repeat the process 2 to 3 times a day. Pineapple Pineapple is rich in bromelain, which is a [protein-digesting enzyme](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK537005/#:~:text=Pepsin%20is%20a%20stomach%20enzyme,1.5%20to%202)%20activates%20pepsin.) that can help remove dead and damaged skin. You can treat warts at home using pineapple. For this, soak the body part with [warts](https://www.villagepediatricgroup.com/2023/01/13/five-clever-ways-to-treat-your-kids-warts/) in pineapple juice daily. You can also apply fresh pineapple slices daily on warts. Garlic Another natural [treatment for warts](https://www.villagepediatricgroup.com/2022/11/25/warts-what-to-expect/) is garlic. Garlic contains allicin - an ingredient with antimicrobial activity. To treat the warts of your kid, crush a clove of garlic, mix it with a small amount of water, and apply it directly to growths. Cover the area with the band-aid. Repeat once daily for 3 to 4 weeks. You can also apply garlic juice or rub a garlic clove on the warts. Orange Peel You can also treat your kid's warts by rubbing an orange peel on warts once a day. In 2 to 3 weeks, the growths will get darker and fall off.
